main event: Approximately 20 flight line personnel at Craig AFB, Alabama sighted a white light that seemed to be emitting blue-green waves on August 16, 1962.
interesting points: The light remained stationary for several minutes, then moved rapidly up and down the runway before climbing at a 45 degree angle and disappearing.
The light was observed at approximately 2 to 3 degrees above the horizon for around 2 to 3 minutes.
There was a rocket launch from Cape Kennedy around the same time, which could explain the sighting.
The observers described the light as a bright round disk surrounded by a diffuse halo.
Unfortunately, the Craig AFB control tower and radar facility were not manned at the time of the sighting.
result: explained (likely a rocket launch from Cape Kennedy)
sighted object: a white light emitting blue-green waves
